metadata.title: CVE-2019-19039 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** __btrfs_free_extent in fs/btrfs/extent-tree.c in the Linuxkernel through 5.3.12 calls btrfs_print_leaf in a certain ENOENT case,which allows local users to obtain potentially sensitive information aboutregister values via the dmesg program. NOTE: The BTRFS development teamdisputes this issues as not being a vulnerability because “1) The kernelprovide facilities to restrict access to dmesg - dmesg_restrict=1 sysctloption. So it's really up to the system administrator to judge whetherdmesg access shall be disallowed or not. 2) WARN/WARN_ON are widely usedmacros in the linux kernel. If this CVE is considered valid this would meanthere are literally thousands CVE lurking in the kernel - something whichclearly is not the case.”

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-112-generic - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-112-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-112-lowlatency - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-112-generic - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-112-lowlatency - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1079-aws - 4.15.0-1079.83~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-gcp - 4.15.0-1080.90~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-oracle - 4.15.0-1050.54~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1079.83~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.90~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.54~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
